items.sentence: We live in that apartment just over the street.
My dog and cat live in harmony with each other.
We have more apples than we could eat in a day.
Hard labor was beginning to tell on his health.
The accident took place near that intersection.
The boy showed off his new bicycle to everyone.
A new shopping mall opened on the edge of town.
You shouldn't judge people by their appearance.
That book's done a lot to popularize chemistry.
The more I sleep, the less I feel like working.
Tom and Mary were both too drunk to drive home.
I don't think it'll be hard for you to do that.
There's no use in crying. No one will hear you.
Do you think that you'd like to live in Boston?
Now I understand what you're trying to tell me.
We expect Tom Jackson's new novel to sell well.
When was the last time you gave someone a gift?
We're expecting even more people here tomorrow.
I didn't expect that the test would be so easy.
Tom is in the kitchen, making something to eat.
Tom did the best he could, given the situation.
My father left home when I was three years old.
I don't suppose you could tell me where Tom is.
We were all afraid that Tom would kill himself.
I'd be thankful if you gave me a second chance.
Tom made me do something I'd never done before.
Smoking is banned in restaurants in California.
Tom lent me some books to read over the summer.
Tom was shot while robbing a convenience store.
Didn't Tom tell you anything about his new job?
That's probably the last thing Tom wants to do.
Do you want me to leave my tools here with you?
Do you want me to help you with your suitcases?
Do you want me to take Tom to the mall with me?
Do you really think doing that would be boring?
I've done that more times than I care to admit.
This is the car I told you about the other day.
If you need a flashlight, you can use this one.
You thought that Tom would help us, didn't you?
Tom was determined to get rid of his pot belly.
Did you find out who Tom is getting married to?
Is it true that Tom thinks that I believe that?
Tom's dog hasn't eaten anything for three days.
Why did you tell me that you didn't have a dog?
Tom woke up as soon as his dog started barking.
Tom jumped between the little girl and the dog.
Mary told me she thought that Tom was handsome.
Tom listened carefully to what Mary had to say.
I hope that you can do that as well as Tom did.
There's a church on the other side of the road.
